name: Elizabeth Johnson
text: Been wanting to come at work there. I heard it was a great company to work for.

name: George Cvarkov
text: Looks like good place,easy to check in with security. Security lady will explain everything to you. They have blower so you can clean your trailer pretty nice. Started loading as soon as on dock. Only bad thing is that you can have any passengers with you. So if you have someone it needs to stay in designated area or just hide it 😂

name: Bubba Usry Madisons Music
text: Slow. Slow. Slow.  No excuse for taking 3 hours to load the only trucks there.  Riding the clock is what the employees are doing. Causing our elogs to run out and prevent us from being home on the holiday. Pretty pathetic

name: John Golbuny
text: smells like something died

name: allen holmes
text: Mary is always good to work with.

name: Jesus Chapa
text: The lady in shipping racial profiles people and assumes we cant read English and says she aint the one ! The one for what ?? Can u ask her that . The one for what ?

name: Jason Merritt
text: Good people here

name: Raven Shaw
text: Smells of farts

name: Jaye Lester
text: Disrespectful people

name: Pablo Morales
text: Malo para cargar es pésimo tardaron 4 horas para cargarme

name: yoel fando
text:
(Translated by Google) Slow but lennnnnnnntoooooooooossssss
For all
Without slow

(Original)
Lentos pero lennnnnnnntoooooooooossssss
Para todo
Sin lentos

name: Eroz R
text:
Picking up? Please bring your own hard hat or they will lend you one smelling like cr@p.
Strict rules Safety vest required, hard hat, and closed toes shoes.
Trailer must also be swept clean.
Slide your tandems to the back.
They also take a while to start loading you.

name: Thomasita sandoval (sita)
text: Check in slide tandems, check in with guard, If u don't have ur own PPE they will lend u some, after check in process, u scale, if ur unloading cardboard the docks r right when u get off the scale, wait for forklift operator to watch u open doors and back in, was a quick unload, then have brooms u can use to sweep out ur trailer well ur still docked, after that's complete u scale out again and check out with guard and return PPE borrowed.. seemed like a lot at first n I did get lost but this is why I'm posting a comment so it will be helpful to the new people..

name: John
text: If you are picking up go to Gate 6. Trailer should not be older than 10 yrs and no damage. If it is then they gonna reject your trailer.

name: Nanos T
text: Only by appt taking paper

name: Minnie
text: Came into gate 6 approximately 6.5hrs early & they docked me immediately. Wrote on the check in paper that I was told to come early because load was ready.

name: Joe Newton
text:
The people at the guard shack are nice enough. But refusing to unload someone because they aren't picking up afterwards? Thanks for wasting my time.

Edit for info: if you are delivering recycled cardboard, it's gate 6

name: mohammad yasin
text:
To many chief in this facility and no one on the unloading dock.
As O/O, it's worthless to come back to this place.
Wouldn't recommend it for any  O/O

name: Nathan Lindahl
text: Guess they supposedly started going by appt times in the last 5 months but I've been here 5 times since then and never got asked for delivery time, I said so the last 5 times didn't matter? Now I have to wait 4.5 hours to check in, no food no nothing around this hell hole.

name: scott ward
text: Sometimes is good sometimes it's not.

name: Robert Lucas
text: Live unload canceled for 4 days ridiculous 😠

name: David Simmons
text: Unprofessional to make drivers wait over 3 hours to get unloaded, management  and union workers need to step it up big time

name: Corey Autrey
text: Fine place to work on

name: J.W. Rags
text: Gate 6 for shipping rolls of paper.

name: Prodigal Son
text: It's easy work but if you can't walk on a gigantic conveyor and work in hot environment don't even waste your time applying, they only have one small break room for the whole facility you have to be on your feet even when you eat SMH.

name: K Owens
text: Delivery of roll stock w 53'dry van. Use 2nd (truck entrance) go 400 feet to corner of building,  last dock. Slide  tandems,  dock & DC red air line.  Staff friendly and helpful.

name: BARGAIN BOX BREAKS
text: Employee Jarrod Brewer is a scammer and owes a lot of people money in the sports card world. I want the company to do the right thing, because he could also be stealing from you!!!

name: darryl Overton
text: Employee Jarrod Brewer is a Scammer and is stealing money from people over sports cards. SMH.

name: Ronnie Hill
text: Delivered a load there, straight forward with no issues at all. The lady who gave me instructions was very nice and helpful.

name: Surinder Boparai
text: Not bad takes about an hour to unload

name: Jacob Fuller
text: Jarrod Brewer is an employee here and is a thief

name: Gurpreet Brar
text: Roll truck delivery Enter at 2nd driway as soon as you enter you will see sign says roll delivery 400 mtrs drive end of the building and you will see single dock on ur left slide axles break seal and open doors jus back in and take your paperwork inside....

name: Carol Edwards
text: Don't know much about those place. I was taking lunch to someone. I hear that the pay is pretty good for anyone looking for work.

name: Thomas Brown
text: Workers were friendly and helpful, but this is one of the foulest smelling places I have been.

name: Clay Ross
text: The best place to work in Dallas County in my opinion.

name: Michael Whetstone
text: This is a great company to visit or work for!

name: Derron Hatcher
text: Great place.

name: Zachery Campbell
text: Great place to work!

name: K Owens
text:
Drp n Hook w 53 dry van, check in can be slow sometimes. Staff friendly and helpful.
Overnight parking available.

name: Tony Mehan
text: Must be something about it, been here 40 years

name: Kevin F
text:
Arrived at 0730 for 0800 preloaded trailer. Its noon still haven't even taken the empty from here to the dock to be loaded because they are still making more product. They also advised its not uncommon for drivers to wait 2-3 days for a load.  I'm kinda surprised we are even sent here. Good luck all.
Followup: now here for 25 hours. Still no idea of a time frame. They tried sending me for a live load but security at Gate 1, which is where I was told to go,  turned me around. This is beyond ridiculous.

name: Jon Daniels
text: Came to pick up a preloaded trailers at 8am. Sitting here at 8pm still waiting. Gotta love it

name: Larry Ankrum
text: Live load been here for 16 hours would advise if you can help it don't come here

name: Tetiana Kruglia
text: My driver  driver checked in  at 2:45pm there was 3 trucks in front of him    got loaded only at 2am.

name: Gustavo Lara
text: Waiting time loading more than 10 hours

name: Aeryn Darby
text: Advice to security management. Make a map for us please. Don't rely on personnel to direct us. Very imprecise. This gate, that yard, back, forth, gate 1 ... 45 mins later I find where I'm supposed to load. 2 others at dock expressed similar experience. At the very least put someone who cares about keeping the paying job at gate 9.

name: Yichen Bu
text:
Can't believe the long wait. Not sure how they can stay open the business.
Looks like one hour per truck. Check in with security first. Wait in the truck. So far I'm the third in line. Two in front of me. Two behind me.

name: Michael Vogt
text: Horrible place to get live loaded. 3+ hours at a dock and still haven't started the loading yet.

name: scott ward
text: Not bad have the days

name: MissNicolenesss
text: No one working here knew what to do, tried sending our truck into dangerous situations. Ran us around for hours. I saw several pipes spewing leaks into the soil, and the whole place looks flooded. Pot holes everywhere, horrible uneven mud roads, every employee but one was unporfessional and unprepared. They tried unloading us without a dock. There is random stuff in all the lots and roads, making it hazardous to get around. It smells like rotting fish, but then again it's a paper mill. That's how they smell.

name: mark s
text: Thanks to Tom's review,  I avoided the drive back. They are building a new office, so it does not look like a gas station anymore, still lots of mud tho.

name: tom murphy
text: Not a bad paper mill. If you're picking up a loaded trailer, don't stop at the warehouse. Drive down to the abandoned gas station being used as a trailer drop yard. That's the spot in Pennington for all the hottest drop and hook action.

name: Lewis ODonohue
text: Long wait for chip trucks

name: Artur Terletskyy
text: LONG LONG LONG LONG

name: Gerald Pritchard
text: Was ok in and ouy

name: k L
text: Slow

name: J Me
text: Besides the mud, they are friendly and help pull loads out of the mud puddle they dropped in

name: James M
text: Just another paper mill.
